00001 #ifndef __LINUX_VIDEODEV2_H
00002 #define __LINUX_VIDEODEV2_H
00003 /*
00004  *   Video for Linux Two
00005  *
00006  *   Header file for v4l or V4L2 drivers and applications, for
00007  *   Linux kernels 2.2.x or 2.4.x.
00008  *
00009  *   See http://bytesex.org/v4l/ for API specs and other
00010  *   v4l2 documentation.
00011  *
00012  *   Author: Bill Dirks <bdirks@pacbell.net>
00013  *        Justin Schoeman
00014  *        et al.
00015  */
00016 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00017 #include <linux/time.h> /* need struct timeval */
00018 #endif
00019 
00020 /*
00021  *   M I S C E L L A N E O U S
00022  */
00023 
00024 /*  Four-character-code (FOURCC) */
00025 #define v4l2_fourcc(a,b,c,d)\
00026         (((__u32)(a)<<0)|((__u32)(b)<<8)|((__u32)(c)<<16)|((__u32)(d)<<24))
00027 
00028 /*
00029  *   E N U M S
00030  */
00031 enum v4l2_field {
00032      V4L2_FIELD_ANY        = 0, /* driver can choose from none,
00033                           top, bottom, interlaced
00034                           depending on whatever it thinks
00035                           is approximate ... */
00036      V4L2_FIELD_NONE       = 1, /* this device has no fields ... */
00037      V4L2_FIELD_TOP        = 2, /* top field only */
00038      V4L2_FIELD_BOTTOM     = 3, /* bottom field only */
00039      V4L2_FIELD_INTERLACED = 4, /* both fields interlaced */
00040      V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_TB     = 5, /* both fields sequential into one
00041                           buffer, top-bottom order */
00042      V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_BT     = 6, /* same as above + bottom-top order */
00043      V4L2_FIELD_ALTERNATE  = 7, /* both fields alternating into
00044                           separate buffers */
00045 };
00046 #define V4L2_FIELD_HAS_TOP(field)  \
00047      ((field) == V4L2_FIELD_TOP    ||\
00048       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_INTERLACED ||\
00049       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_TB ||\
00050       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_BT)
00051 #define V4L2_FIELD_HAS_BOTTOM(field)    \
00052      ((field) == V4L2_FIELD_BOTTOM      ||\
00053       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_INTERLACED ||\
00054       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_TB ||\
00055       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_BT)
00056 #define V4L2_FIELD_HAS_BOTH(field) \
00057      ((field) == V4L2_FIELD_INTERLACED ||\
00058       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_TB ||\
00059       (field) == V4L2_FIELD_SEQ_BT)
00060 
00061 enum v4l2_buf_type {
00062      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VIDEO_CAPTURE  = 1,
00063      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VIDEO_OUTPUT   = 2,
00064      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VIDEO_OVERLAY  = 3,
00065      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VBI_CAPTURE    = 4,
00066      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VBI_OUTPUT     = 5,
00067      V4L2_BUF_TYPE_PRIVATE        = 0x80,
00068 };
00069 
00070 enum v4l2_ctrl_type {
00071      V4L2_CTRL_TYPE_INTEGER        = 1,
00072      V4L2_CTRL_TYPE_BOOLEAN        = 2,
00073      V4L2_CTRL_TYPE_MENU      = 3,
00074      V4L2_CTRL_TYPE_BUTTON         = 4,
00075 };

00077 enum v4l2_tuner_type {
00078      V4L2_TUNER_RADIO         = 1,
00079      V4L2_TUNER_ANALOG_TV          = 2,
00080 };

00082 enum v4l2_memory {
00083      V4L2_MEMORY_MMAP             = 1,
00084      V4L2_MEMORY_USERPTR          = 2,
00085      V4L2_MEMORY_OVERLAY          = 3,
00086 };

00088 /* see also http://vektor.theorem.ca/graphics/ycbcr/ */
00089 enum v4l2_colorspace {
00090      /* ITU-R 601 -- broadcast NTSC/PAL */
00091      V4L2_COLORSPACE_SMPTE170M     = 1,
00092 
00093      /* 1125-Line (US) HDTV */
00094      V4L2_COLORSPACE_SMPTE240M     = 2,
00095 
00096      /* HD and modern captures. */
00097      V4L2_COLORSPACE_REC709        = 3,
00098      
00099      /* broken BT878 extents (601, luma range 16-253 instead of 16-235) */
00100      V4L2_COLORSPACE_BT878         = 4,
00101      
00102      /* These should be useful.  Assume 601 extents. */
00103      V4L2_COLORSPACE_470_SYSTEM_M  = 5,
00104      V4L2_COLORSPACE_470_SYSTEM_BG = 6,
00105      
00106      /* I know there will be cameras that send this.  So, this is
00107       * unspecified chromaticities and full 0-255 on each of the
00108       * Y'CbCr components
00109       */
00110      V4L2_COLORSPACE_JPEG          = 7,
00111      
00112      /* For RGB colourspaces, this is probably a good start. */
00113      V4L2_COLORSPACE_SRGB          = 8,
00114 };
00115 
00116 enum v4l2_priority {
00117      V4L2_PRIORITY_UNSET       = 0,  /* not initialized */
00118      V4L2_PRIORITY_BACKGROUND  = 1,
00119      V4L2_PRIORITY_INTERACTIVE = 2,
00120      V4L2_PRIORITY_RECORD      = 3,
00121      V4L2_PRIORITY_DEFAULT     = V4L2_PRIORITY_INTERACTIVE,
00122 };
00123 
00124 struct v4l2_rect {

00126      __s32   top;
00127      __s32   width;
00128      __s32   height;
00129 };

00131 struct v4l2_fract {
00132      __u32   numerator;
00133      __u32   denominator;
00134 };

00136 /*
00137  *   D R I V E R   C A P A B I L I T I E S
00138  */
00139 struct v4l2_capability
00140 {
00141      __u8 driver[16];    /* i.e. "bttv" */
00142      __u8 card[32]; /* i.e. "Hauppauge WinTV" */
00143      __u8 bus_info[32];  /* "PCI:" + pci_name(pci_dev) */
00144      __u32   version;        /* should use KERNEL_VERSION() */
00145      __u32     capabilities;  /* Device capabilities */
00146      __u32     reserved[4];
00147 };
00148 
00149 /* Values for 'capabilities' field */
00150 #define V4L2_CAP_VIDEO_CAPTURE     0x00000001  /* Is a video capture device */
00151 #define V4L2_CAP_VIDEO_OUTPUT 0x00000002  /* Is a video output device */
00152 #define V4L2_CAP_VIDEO_OVERLAY     0x00000004  /* Can do video overlay */
00153 #define V4L2_CAP_VBI_CAPTURE  0x00000010  /* Is a VBI capture device */
00154 #define V4L2_CAP_VBI_OUTPUT   0x00000020  /* Is a VBI output device */
00155 #define V4L2_CAP_RDS_CAPTURE  0x00000100  /* RDS data capture */
00156 
00157 #define V4L2_CAP_TUNER        0x00010000  /* has a tuner */
00158 #define V4L2_CAP_AUDIO        0x00020000  /* has audio support */
00159 #define V4L2_CAP_RADIO        0x00040000  /* is a radio device */
00160 
00161 #define V4L2_CAP_READWRITE      0x01000000  /* read/write systemcalls */
00162 #define V4L2_CAP_ASYNCIO        0x02000000  /* async I/O */
00163 #define V4L2_CAP_STREAMING      0x04000000  /* streaming I/O ioctls */
00164 
00165 /*
00166  *   V I D E O   I M A G E   F O R M A T
00167  */
00168 
00169 struct v4l2_pix_format
00170 {
00171      __u32               width;
00172      __u32               height;
00173      __u32               pixelformat;
00174      enum v4l2_field     field;
00175      __u32               bytesperline;  /* for padding, zero if unused */
00176      __u32                    sizeimage;
00177         enum v4l2_colorspace  colorspace;
00178      __u32               priv;          /* private data, depends on pixelformat */
00179 };
00180 
00181 /*           Pixel format    FOURCC                  depth  Description   */
00182 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB332  v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','1') /*  8  RGB-3-3-2     */
00183 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB555  v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','O') /* 16  RGB-5-5-5     */
00184 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB565  v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','P') /* 16  RGB-5-6-5     */
00185 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB555X v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','Q') /* 16  RGB-5-5-5 BE  */
00186 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB565X v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','R') /* 16  RGB-5-6-5 BE  */
00187 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_BGR24   v4l2_fourcc('B','G','R','3') /* 24  BGR-8-8-8     */
00188 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB24   v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','3') /* 24  RGB-8-8-8     */
00189 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_BGR32   v4l2_fourcc('B','G','R','4') /* 32  BGR-8-8-8-8   */
00190 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_RGB32   v4l2_fourcc('R','G','B','4') /* 32  RGB-8-8-8-8   */
00191 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_GREY    v4l2_fourcc('G','R','E','Y') /*  8  Greyscale     */
00192 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YVU410  v4l2_fourcc('Y','V','U','9') /*  9  YVU 4:1:0     */
00193 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YVU420  v4l2_fourcc('Y','V','1','2') /* 12  YVU 4:2:0     */
00194 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YUYV    v4l2_fourcc('Y','U','Y','V') /* 16  YUV 4:2:2     */
00195 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_UYVY    v4l2_fourcc('U','Y','V','Y') /* 16  YUV 4:2:2     */
00196 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YUV422P v4l2_fourcc('4','2','2','P') /* 16  YVU422 planar */
00197 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YUV411P v4l2_fourcc('4','1','1','P') /* 16  YVU411 planar */
00198 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_Y41P    v4l2_fourcc('Y','4','1','P') /* 12  YUV 4:1:1     */
00199 
00200 /* two planes -- one Y, one Cr + Cb interleaved  */
00201 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_NV12    v4l2_fourcc('N','V','1','2') /* 12  Y/CbCr 4:2:0  */
00202 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_NV21    v4l2_fourcc('N','V','2','1') /* 12  Y/CrCb 4:2:0  */
00203 
00204 /*  The following formats are not defined in the V4L2 specification */
00205 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YUV410  v4l2_fourcc('Y','U','V','9') /*  9  YUV 4:1:0     */
00206 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YUV420  v4l2_fourcc('Y','U','1','2') /* 12  YUV 4:2:0     */
00207 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_YYUV    v4l2_fourcc('Y','Y','U','V') /* 16  YUV 4:2:2     */
00208 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_HI240   v4l2_fourcc('H','I','2','4') /*  8  8-bit color   */
00209 
00210 /* see http://www.siliconimaging.com/RGB%20Bayer.htm */
00211 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_SBGGR8  v4l2_fourcc('B','A','8','1') /*  8  BGBG.. GRGR.. */
00212 
00213 /* compressed formats */
00214 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_MJPEG    v4l2_fourcc('M','J','P','G') /* Motion-JPEG   */
00215 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_JPEG     v4l2_fourcc('J','P','E','G') /* JFIF JPEG     */
00216 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_DV       v4l2_fourcc('d','v','s','d') /* 1394          */
00217 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_MPEG     v4l2_fourcc('M','P','E','G') /* MPEG          */
00218 
00219 /*  Vendor-specific formats   */
00220 #define V4L2_PIX_FMT_WNVA     v4l2_fourcc('W','N','V','A') /* Winnov hw compress */
00221

00225 struct v4l2_fmtdesc
00226 {

00228      enum v4l2_buf_type  type;              /* buffer type        */
00229      __u32               flags;
00230      __u8             description[32];   /* Description string */
00231      __u32                 pixelformat;       /* Format fourcc      */
00232      __u32                 reserved[4];
00233 };

00241 struct v4l2_timecode
00242 {
00243      __u32     type;
00244      __u32     flags;
00245      __u8 frames;
00246      __u8 seconds;
00247      __u8 minutes;
00248      __u8 hours;
00249      __u8 userbits[4];
00250 };
00251 
00252 /*  Type  */
00253 #define V4L2_TC_TYPE_24FPS         1
00254 #define V4L2_TC_TYPE_25FPS         2
00255 #define V4L2_TC_TYPE_30FPS         3
00256 #define V4L2_TC_TYPE_50FPS         4
00257 #define V4L2_TC_TYPE_60FPS         5
00258 
00259 /*  Flags  */
00260 #define V4L2_TC_FLAG_DROPFRAME          0x0001 /* "drop-frame" mode */
00261 #define V4L2_TC_FLAG_COLORFRAME         0x0002
00262 #define V4L2_TC_USERBITS_field          0x000C
00263 #define V4L2_TC_USERBITS_USERDEFINED    0x0000
00264 #define V4L2_TC_USERBITS_8BITCHARS 0x0008
00265 /* The above is based on SMPTE timecodes */

00269  *   C O M P R E S S I O N   P A R A M E T E R S
00270  */
00271 #if 0
00272 /* ### generic compression settings don't work, there is too much
00273  * ### codec-specific stuff.  Maybe reuse that for MPEG codec settings
00274  * ### later ... */
00275 struct v4l2_compression
00276 {
00277      __u32     quality;
00278      __u32     keyframerate;
00279      __u32     pframerate;
00280      __u32     reserved[5];
00281 
00282 /*  what we'll need for MPEG, extracted from some postings on
00283     the v4l list (Gert Vervoort, PlasmaJohn).
00284 
00285 system stream:
00286   - type: elementary stream(ES), packatised elementary stream(s) (PES)
00287     program stream(PS), transport stream(TS)
00288   - system bitrate
00289   - PS packet size (DVD: 2048 bytes, VCD: 2324 bytes)
00290   - TS video PID
00291   - TS audio PID
00292   - TS PCR PID
00293   - TS system information tables (PAT, PMT, CAT, NIT and SIT)
00294   - (MPEG-1 systems stream vs. MPEG-2 program stream (TS not supported
00295     by MPEG-1 systems)
00296 
00297 audio:
00298   - type: MPEG (+Layer I,II,III), AC-3, LPCM
00299   - bitrate
00300   - sampling frequency (DVD: 48 Khz, VCD: 44.1 KHz, 32 kHz)
00301   - Trick Modes? (ff, rew)
00302   - Copyright
00303   - Inverse Telecine
00304 
00305 video:
00306   - picturesize (SIF, 1/2 D1, 2/3 D1, D1) and PAL/NTSC norm can be set
00307     through excisting V4L2 controls
00308   - noise reduction, parameters encoder specific?
00309   - MPEG video version: MPEG-1, MPEG-2
00310   - GOP (Group Of Pictures) definition:
00311     - N: number of frames per GOP
00312     - M: distance between reference (I,P) frames
00313     - open/closed GOP
00314   - quantiser matrix: inter Q matrix (64 bytes) and intra Q matrix (64 bytes)
00315   - quantiser scale: linear or logarithmic
00316   - scanning: alternate or zigzag
00317   - bitrate mode: CBR (constant bitrate) or VBR (variable bitrate).
00318   - target video bitrate for CBR
00319   - target video bitrate for VBR
00320   - maximum video bitrate for VBR - min. quantiser value for VBR
00321   - max. quantiser value for VBR
00322   - adaptive quantisation value
00323   - return the number of bytes per GOP or bitrate for bitrate monitoring
00324 
00325 */
00326 };
00327 #endif
00328 
00329 struct v4l2_jpegcompression
00330 {
00331      int quality;
00332 
00333      int  APPn;              /* Number of APP segment to be written,
00334                      * must be 0..15 */
00335      int  APP_len;           /* Length of data in JPEG APPn segment */
00336      char APP_data[60];      /* Data in the JPEG APPn segment. */
00337      
00338      int  COM_len;           /* Length of data in JPEG COM segment */
00339      char COM_data[60];      /* Data in JPEG COM segment */
00340      
00341      __u32 jpeg_markers;     /* Which markers should go into the JPEG
00342                      * output. Unless you exactly know what
00343                      * you do, leave them untouched.
00344                      * Inluding less markers will make the
00345                      * resulting code smaller, but there will
00346                      * be fewer aplications which can read it.
00347                      * The presence of the APP and COM marker
00348                      * is influenced by APP_len and COM_len
00349                      * ONLY, not by this property! */
00350      
00351 #define V4L2_JPEG_MARKER_DHT (1<<3)    /* Define Huffman Tables */
00352 #define V4L2_JPEG_MARKER_DQT (1<<4)    /* Define Quantization Tables */
00353 #define V4L2_JPEG_MARKER_DRI (1<<5)    /* Define Restart Interval */
00354 #define V4L2_JPEG_MARKER_COM (1<<6)    /* Comment segment */
00355 #define V4L2_JPEG_MARKER_APP (1<<7)    /* App segment, driver will
00356                                         * allways use APP0 */
00357 };

00363 struct v4l2_requestbuffers
00364 {
00365      __u32                     count;
00366      enum v4l2_buf_type      type;
00367      enum v4l2_memory        memory;
00368      __u32                     reserved[2];
00369 };
00370 
00371 struct v4l2_buffer
00372 {
00373      __u32               index;
00374      enum v4l2_buf_type      type;
00375      __u32               bytesused;
00376      __u32               flags;
00377      enum v4l2_field          field;
00378      struct timeval      timestamp;
00379      struct v4l2_timecode     timecode;
00380      __u32               sequence;
00381 
00382      /* memory location */
00383      enum v4l2_memory        memory;
00384      union {
00385           __u32           offset;
00386           unsigned long   userptr;
00387      } m;
00388      __u32               length;
00389      __u32               input;
00390      __u32               reserved;
00391 };
00392 
00393 /*  Flags for 'flags' field */
00394 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_MAPPED  0x0001  /* Buffer is mapped (flag) */
00395 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_QUEUED  0x0002    /* Buffer is queued for processing */
00396 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_DONE    0x0004    /* Buffer is ready */
00397 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_KEYFRAME     0x0008    /* Image is a keyframe (I-frame) */
00398 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_PFRAME  0x0010    /* Image is a P-frame */
00399 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_BFRAME  0x0020    /* Image is a B-frame */
00400 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_TIMECODE     0x0100    /* timecode field is valid */
00401 #define V4L2_BUF_FLAG_INPUT     0x0200  /* input field is valid */
00402 
00403 /*
00404  *   O V E R L A Y   P R E V I E W
00405  */
00406 struct v4l2_framebuffer
00407 {
00408      __u32               capability;
00409      __u32               flags;
00410 /* FIXME: in theory we should pass something like PCI device + memory
00411  * region + offset instead of some physical address */
00412      void*                   base;
00413      struct v4l2_pix_format   fmt;
00414 };
00415 /*  Flags for the 'capability' field. Read only */
00416 #define V4L2_FBUF_CAP_EXTERNOVERLAY     0x0001
00417 #define V4L2_FBUF_CAP_CHROMAKEY         0x0002
00418 #define V4L2_FBUF_CAP_LIST_CLIPPING     0x0004
00419 #define V4L2_FBUF_CAP_BITMAP_CLIPPING   0x0008
00420 /*  Flags for the 'flags' field. */
00421 #define V4L2_FBUF_FLAG_PRIMARY          0x0001
00422 #define V4L2_FBUF_FLAG_OVERLAY          0x0002
00423 #define V4L2_FBUF_FLAG_CHROMAKEY   0x0004

00442 /*
00443  *   C A P T U R E   P A R A M E T E R S
00444  */
00445 struct v4l2_captureparm
00446 {
00447      __u32             capability;   /*  Supported modes */
00448      __u32             capturemode;       /*  Current mode */
00449      struct v4l2_fract  timeperframe;  /*  Time per frame in .1us units */
00450      __u32             extendedmode;  /*  Driver-specific extensions */
00451      __u32              readbuffers;   /*  # of buffers for read */
00452      __u32             reserved[4];
00453 };
00454 /*  Flags for 'capability' and 'capturemode' fields */
00455 #define V4L2_MODE_HIGHQUALITY 0x0001    /*  High quality imaging mode */
00456 #define V4L2_CAP_TIMEPERFRAME 0x1000    /*  timeperframe field is supported */
00457 
00458 struct v4l2_outputparm
00459 {
00460      __u32             capability;  /*  Supported modes */
00461      __u32             outputmode;  /*  Current mode */
00462      struct v4l2_fract  timeperframe; /*  Time per frame in seconds */
00463      __u32             extendedmode; /*  Driver-specific extensions */
00464      __u32              writebuffers; /*  # of buffers for write */
00465      __u32             reserved[4];
00466 };

00487 
00488 typedef __u64 v4l2_std_id;
00489 
00490 /* one bit for each */
00491 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_B          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000001)
00492 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_B1         ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000002)
00493 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_G          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000004)
00494 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_H          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000008)
00495 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_I          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000010)
00496 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_D          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000020)
00497 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_D1         ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000040)
00498 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_K          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000080)
00499 
00500 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_M          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000100)
00501 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_N          ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000200)
00502 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_Nc         ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000400)
00503 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_60         ((v4l2_std_id)0x00000800)
00504 
00505 #define V4L2_STD_NTSC_M         ((v4l2_std_id)0x00001000)
00506 #define V4L2_STD_NTSC_M_JP      ((v4l2_std_id)0x00002000)
00507 
00508 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_B        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00010000)
00509 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_D        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00020000)
00510 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_G        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00040000)
00511 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_H        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00080000)
00512 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_K        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00100000)
00513 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_K1       ((v4l2_std_id)0x00200000)
00514 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_L        ((v4l2_std_id)0x00400000)
00515 
00516 /* ATSC/HDTV */
00517 #define V4L2_STD_ATSC_8_VSB     ((v4l2_std_id)0x01000000)
00518 #define V4L2_STD_ATSC_16_VSB    ((v4l2_std_id)0x02000000)
00519 
00520 /* some common needed stuff */
00521 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_BG       (V4L2_STD_PAL_B          |\
00522                      V4L2_STD_PAL_B1    |\
00523                      V4L2_STD_PAL_G)
00524 #define V4L2_STD_PAL_DK       (V4L2_STD_PAL_D          |\
00525                      V4L2_STD_PAL_D1    |\
00526                      V4L2_STD_PAL_K)
00527 #define V4L2_STD_PAL          (V4L2_STD_PAL_BG    |\
00528                      V4L2_STD_PAL_DK    |\
00529                      V4L2_STD_PAL_H          |\
00530                      V4L2_STD_PAL_I)
00531 #define V4L2_STD_NTSC           (V4L2_STD_NTSC_M  |\
00532                      V4L2_STD_NTSC_M_JP)
00533 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM_DK          (V4L2_STD_SECAM_D   |\
00534                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_K   |\
00535                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_K1)
00536 #define V4L2_STD_SECAM        (V4L2_STD_SECAM_B   |\
00537                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_G   |\
00538                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_H   |\
00539                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_DK  |\
00540                      V4L2_STD_SECAM_L)
00541 
00542 #define V4L2_STD_525_60       (V4L2_STD_PAL_M          |\
00543                      V4L2_STD_PAL_60    |\
00544                      V4L2_STD_NTSC)
00545 #define V4L2_STD_625_50       (V4L2_STD_PAL       |\
00546                      V4L2_STD_PAL_N          |\
00547                      V4L2_STD_PAL_Nc    |\
00548                      V4L2_STD_SECAM)
00549 #define V4L2_STD_ATSC           (V4L2_STD_ATSC_8_VSB    |\
00550                            V4L2_STD_ATSC_16_VSB)
00551 
00552 #define V4L2_STD_UNKNOWN        0
00553 #define V4L2_STD_ALL            (V4L2_STD_525_60  |\
00554                      V4L2_STD_625_50)
00555 
00556 struct v4l2_standard
00557 {
00558      __u32                    index;
00559      v4l2_std_id          id;
00560      __u8           name[24];
00561      struct v4l2_fract    frameperiod; /* Frames, not fields */
00562      __u32               framelines;
00563      __u32               reserved[4];
00564 };
00565 
00566 
00567 /*
00568  *   V I D E O   I N P U T S
00569  */
00570 struct v4l2_input
00571 {
00572      __u32          index;         /*  Which input */
00573      __u8      name[32];         /*  Label */
00574      __u32          type;          /*  Type of input */
00575      __u32          audioset;         /*  Associated audios (bitfield) */
00576      __u32        tuner;             /*  Associated tuner */
00577      v4l2_std_id  std;
00578      __u32          status;
00579      __u32          reserved[4];
00580 };
00581 /*  Values for the 'type' field */
00582 #define V4L2_INPUT_TYPE_TUNER      1
00583 #define V4L2_INPUT_TYPE_CAMERA          2
00584 
00585 /* field 'status' - general */
00586 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_POWER    0x00000001  /* Attached device is off */
00587 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_SIGNAL   0x00000002
00588 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_COLOR    0x00000004
00589 
00590 /* field 'status' - analog */
00591 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_H_LOCK   0x00000100  /* No horizontal sync lock */
00592 #define V4L2_IN_ST_COLOR_KILL  0x00000200  /* Color killer is active */
00593 
00594 /* field 'status' - digital */
00595 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_SYNC     0x00010000  /* No synchronization lock */
00596 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_EQU      0x00020000  /* No equalizer lock */
00597 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_CARRIER  0x00040000  /* Carrier recovery failed */
00598 
00599 /* field 'status' - VCR and set-top box */
00600 #define V4L2_IN_ST_MACROVISION 0x01000000  /* Macrovision detected */
00601 #define V4L2_IN_ST_NO_ACCESS   0x02000000  /* Conditional access denied */
00602 #define V4L2_IN_ST_VTR         0x04000000  /* VTR time constant */
00603 
00604 /*
00605  *   V I D E O   O U T P U T S
00606  */
00607 struct v4l2_output
00608 {
00609      __u32          index;         /*  Which output */
00610      __u8      name[32];         /*  Label */
00611      __u32          type;          /*  Type of output */
00612      __u32          audioset;         /*  Associated audios (bitfield) */
00613      __u32          modulator;         /*  Associated modulator */
00614      v4l2_std_id  std;
00615      __u32          reserved[4];
00616 };
00617 /*  Values for the 'type' field */
00618 #define V4L2_OUTPUT_TYPE_MODULATOR      1
00619 #define V4L2_OUTPUT_TYPE_ANALOG              2
00620 #define V4L2_OUTPUT_TYPE_ANALOGVGAOVERLAY    3
00621 
00622 /*
00623  *   C O N T R O L S
00624  */
00625 struct v4l2_control
00626 {
00627      __u32               id;
00628      __s32               value;
00629 };
00630 
00631 /*  Used in the VIDIOC_QUERYCTRL ioctl for querying controls */
00632 struct v4l2_queryctrl
00633 {
00634      __u32                  id;
00635      enum v4l2_ctrl_type  type;
00636      __u8           name[32]; /* Whatever */
00637      __s32               minimum;  /* Note signedness */
00638      __s32               maximum;
00639      __s32                  step;
00640      __s32               default_value;
00641      __u32                flags;
00642      __u32               reserved[2];
00643 };
00644 
00645 /*  Used in the VIDIOC_QUERYMENU ioctl for querying menu items */
00646 struct v4l2_querymenu
00647 {
00648      __u32          id;
00649      __u32          index;
00650      __u8      name[32]; /* Whatever */
00651      __u32          reserved;
00652 };
00653 
00654 /*  Control flags  */
00655 #define V4L2_CTRL_FLAG_DISABLED         0x0001
00656 #define V4L2_CTRL_FLAG_GRABBED          0x0002
00657 
00658 /*  Control IDs defined by V4L2 */
00659 #define V4L2_CID_BASE              0x00980900
00660 /*  IDs reserved for driver specific controls */
00661 #define V4L2_CID_PRIVATE_BASE      0x08000000
00662 
00663 #define V4L2_CID_BRIGHTNESS        (V4L2_CID_BASE+0)
00664 #define V4L2_CID_CONTRAST          (V4L2_CID_BASE+1)
00665 #define V4L2_CID_SATURATION        (V4L2_CID_BASE+2)
00666 #define V4L2_CID_HUE               (V4L2_CID_BASE+3)
00667 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_VOLUME      (V4L2_CID_BASE+5)
00668 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_BALANCE          (V4L2_CID_BASE+6)
00669 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_BASS        (V4L2_CID_BASE+7)
00670 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_TREBLE      (V4L2_CID_BASE+8)
00671 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_MUTE        (V4L2_CID_BASE+9)
00672 #define V4L2_CID_AUDIO_LOUDNESS         (V4L2_CID_BASE+10)
00673 #define V4L2_CID_BLACK_LEVEL       (V4L2_CID_BASE+11)
00674 #define V4L2_CID_AUTO_WHITE_BALANCE     (V4L2_CID_BASE+12)
00675 #define V4L2_CID_DO_WHITE_BALANCE  (V4L2_CID_BASE+13)
00676 #define V4L2_CID_RED_BALANCE       (V4L2_CID_BASE+14)
00677 #define V4L2_CID_BLUE_BALANCE      (V4L2_CID_BASE+15)
00678 #define V4L2_CID_GAMMA             (V4L2_CID_BASE+16)
00679 #define V4L2_CID_WHITENESS         (V4L2_CID_GAMMA) /* ? Not sure */
00680 #define V4L2_CID_EXPOSURE          (V4L2_CID_BASE+17)
00681 #define V4L2_CID_AUTOGAIN          (V4L2_CID_BASE+18)
00682 #define V4L2_CID_GAIN              (V4L2_CID_BASE+19)
00683 #define V4L2_CID_HFLIP             (V4L2_CID_BASE+20)
00684 #define V4L2_CID_VFLIP             (V4L2_CID_BASE+21)
00685 #define V4L2_CID_HCENTER      (V4L2_CID_BASE+22)
00686 #define V4L2_CID_VCENTER      (V4L2_CID_BASE+23)
00687 #define V4L2_CID_LASTP1            (V4L2_CID_BASE+24) /* last CID + 1 */
00688 
00689 /*
00690  *   T U N I N G
00691  */
00692 struct v4l2_tuner
00693 {
00694      __u32                   index;
00695      __u8           name[32];
00696      enum v4l2_tuner_type    type;
00697      __u32               capability;
00698      __u32               rangelow;
00699      __u32               rangehigh;
00700      __u32               rxsubchans;
00701      __u32               audmode;
00702      __s32               signal;
00703      __s32               afc;
00704      __u32               reserved[4];
00705 };
00706 
00707 struct v4l2_modulator
00708 {
00709      __u32               index;
00710      __u8           name[32];
00711      __u32               capability;
00712      __u32               rangelow;
00713      __u32               rangehigh;
00714      __u32               txsubchans;
00715      __u32               reserved[4];
00716 };
00717 
00718 /*  Flags for the 'capability' field */
00719 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_LOW         0x0001
00720 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_NORM        0x0002
00721 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_STEREO      0x0010
00722 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_LANG2       0x0020
00723 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_SAP         0x0020
00724 #define V4L2_TUNER_CAP_LANG1       0x0040
00725 
00726 /*  Flags for the 'rxsubchans' field */
00727 #define V4L2_TUNER_SUB_MONO        0x0001
00728 #define V4L2_TUNER_SUB_STEREO      0x0002
00729 #define V4L2_TUNER_SUB_LANG2       0x0004
00730 #define V4L2_TUNER_SUB_SAP         0x0004
00731 #define V4L2_TUNER_SUB_LANG1       0x0008
00732 
00733 /*  Values for the 'audmode' field */
00734 #define V4L2_TUNER_MODE_MONO       0x0000
00735 #define V4L2_TUNER_MODE_STEREO          0x0001
00736 #define V4L2_TUNER_MODE_LANG2      0x0002
00737 #define V4L2_TUNER_MODE_SAP        0x0002
00738 #define V4L2_TUNER_MODE_LANG1      0x0003
00739 
00740 struct v4l2_frequency
00741 {
00742      __u32                   tuner;
00743      enum v4l2_tuner_type  type;
00744         __u32                frequency;
00745      __u32                   reserved[8];
00746 };
00747 
00748 /*
00749  *   A U D I O
00750  */
00751 struct v4l2_audio
00752 {
00753      __u32     index;
00754      __u8 name[32];
00755      __u32     capability;
00756      __u32     mode;
00757      __u32     reserved[2];
00758 };
00759 /*  Flags for the 'capability' field */
00760 #define V4L2_AUDCAP_STEREO         0x00001
00761 #define V4L2_AUDCAP_AVL            0x00002
00762 
00763 /*  Flags for the 'mode' field */
00764 #define V4L2_AUDMODE_AVL      0x00001
00765 
00766 struct v4l2_audioout
00767 {
00768      __u32     index;
00769      __u8 name[32];
00770      __u32     capability;
00771      __u32     mode;
00772      __u32     reserved[2];
00773 };
00774 
00775 /*
00776  *   D A T A   S E R V I C E S   ( V B I )
00777  *
00778  *   Data services API by Michael Schimek
00779  */
00780 
00781 struct v4l2_vbi_format
00782 {
00783      __u32     sampling_rate;      /* in 1 Hz */
00784      __u32     offset;
00785      __u32     samples_per_line;
00786      __u32     sample_format;      /* V4L2_PIX_FMT_* */
00787      __s32     start[2];
00788      __u32     count[2];
00789      __u32     flags;              /* V4L2_VBI_* */
00790      __u32     reserved[2];        /* must be zero */
00791 };
00792 
00793 /*  VBI flags  */
00794 #define V4L2_VBI_UNSYNC       (1<< 0)
00795 #define V4L2_VBI_INTERLACED   (1<< 1)
00796 
00797 
00798 /*
00799  *   A G G R E G A T E   S T R U C T U R E S
00800  */
00801 
00802 /*   Stream data format
00803  */
00804 struct v4l2_format
00805 {
00806      enum v4l2_buf_type type;
00807      union
00808      {
00809           struct v4l2_pix_format   pix;  // V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VIDEO_CAPTURE
00810           struct v4l2_window  win;  // V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VIDEO_OVERLAY
00811           struct v4l2_vbi_format   vbi;  // V4L2_BUF_TYPE_VBI_CAPTURE
00812           __u8 raw_data[200];        // user-defined
00813      } fmt;
00814 };
00815 
00816 
00817 /*   Stream type-dependent parameters
00818  */
00819 struct v4l2_streamparm
00820 {
00821      enum v4l2_buf_type type;
00822      union
00823      {
00824           struct v4l2_captureparm  capture;
00825           struct v4l2_outputparm   output;
00826           __u8 raw_data[200];  /* user-defined */
00827      } parm;
00828 };
00829 
00830 
00831 
00832 /*
00833  *   I O C T L   C O D E S   F O R   V I D E O   D E V I C E S
00834  *
00835  */
00836 #define VIDIOC_QUERYCAP       _IOR  ('V',  0, struct v4l2_capability)
00837 #define VIDIOC_RESERVED       _IO   ('V',  1)
00838 #define VIDIOC_ENUM_FMT         _IOWR ('V',  2, struct v4l2_fmtdesc)
00839 #define VIDIOC_G_FMT          _IOWR ('V',  4, struct v4l2_format)
00840 #define VIDIOC_S_FMT          _IOWR ('V',  5, struct v4l2_format)
00841 #if 0
00842 #define VIDIOC_G_COMP         _IOR  ('V',  6, struct v4l2_compression)
00843 #define VIDIOC_S_COMP         _IOW  ('V',  7, struct v4l2_compression)
00844 #endif
00845 #define VIDIOC_REQBUFS        _IOWR ('V',  8, struct v4l2_requestbuffers)
00846 #define VIDIOC_QUERYBUF       _IOWR ('V',  9, struct v4l2_buffer)
00847 #define VIDIOC_G_FBUF         _IOR  ('V', 10, struct v4l2_framebuffer)
00848 #define VIDIOC_S_FBUF         _IOW  ('V', 11, struct v4l2_framebuffer)
00849 #define VIDIOC_OVERLAY        _IOW  ('V', 14, int)
00850 #define VIDIOC_QBUF      _IOWR ('V', 15, struct v4l2_buffer)
00851 #define VIDIOC_DQBUF          _IOWR ('V', 17, struct v4l2_buffer)
00852 #define VIDIOC_STREAMON       _IOW  ('V', 18, int)
00853 #define VIDIOC_STREAMOFF _IOW  ('V', 19, int)
00854 #define VIDIOC_G_PARM         _IOWR ('V', 21, struct v4l2_streamparm)
00855 #define VIDIOC_S_PARM         _IOWR ('V', 22, struct v4l2_streamparm)
00856 #define VIDIOC_G_STD          _IOR  ('V', 23, v4l2_std_id)
00857 #define VIDIOC_S_STD          _IOW  ('V', 24, v4l2_std_id)
00858 #define VIDIOC_ENUMSTD        _IOWR ('V', 25, struct v4l2_standard)
00859 #define VIDIOC_ENUMINPUT _IOWR ('V', 26, struct v4l2_input)
00860 #define VIDIOC_G_CTRL         _IOWR ('V', 27, struct v4l2_control)
00861 #define VIDIOC_S_CTRL         _IOWR ('V', 28, struct v4l2_control)
00862 #define VIDIOC_G_TUNER        _IOWR ('V', 29, struct v4l2_tuner)
00863 #define VIDIOC_S_TUNER        _IOW  ('V', 30, struct v4l2_tuner)
00864 #define VIDIOC_G_AUDIO        _IOR  ('V', 33, struct v4l2_audio)
00865 #define VIDIOC_S_AUDIO        _IOW  ('V', 34, struct v4l2_audio)
00866 #define VIDIOC_QUERYCTRL _IOWR ('V', 36, struct v4l2_queryctrl)
00867 #define VIDIOC_QUERYMENU _IOWR ('V', 37, struct v4l2_querymenu)
00868 #define VIDIOC_G_INPUT        _IOR  ('V', 38, int)
00869 #define VIDIOC_S_INPUT        _IOWR ('V', 39, int)
00870 #define VIDIOC_G_OUTPUT       _IOR  ('V', 46, int)
00871 #define VIDIOC_S_OUTPUT       _IOWR ('V', 47, int)
00872 #define VIDIOC_ENUMOUTPUT     _IOWR ('V', 48, struct v4l2_output)
00873 #define VIDIOC_G_AUDOUT       _IOR  ('V', 49, struct v4l2_audioout)
00874 #define VIDIOC_S_AUDOUT       _IOW  ('V', 50, struct v4l2_audioout)
00875 #define VIDIOC_G_MODULATOR    _IOWR ('V', 54, struct v4l2_modulator)
00876 #define VIDIOC_S_MODULATOR    _IOW  ('V', 55, struct v4l2_modulator)
00877 #define VIDIOC_G_FREQUENCY    _IOWR ('V', 56, struct v4l2_frequency)
00878 #define VIDIOC_S_FREQUENCY    _IOW  ('V', 57, struct v4l2_frequency)
00879 #define VIDIOC_CROPCAP        _IOWR ('V', 58, struct v4l2_cropcap)
00880 #define VIDIOC_G_CROP         _IOWR ('V', 59, struct v4l2_crop)
00881 #define VIDIOC_S_CROP         _IOW  ('V', 60, struct v4l2_crop)
00882 #define VIDIOC_G_JPEGCOMP     _IOR  ('V', 61, struct v4l2_jpegcompression)
00883 #define VIDIOC_S_JPEGCOMP     _IOW  ('V', 62, struct v4l2_jpegcompression)
00884 #define VIDIOC_QUERYSTD       _IOR  ('V', 63, v4l2_std_id)
00885 #define VIDIOC_TRY_FMT        _IOWR ('V', 64, struct v4l2_format)
00886 #define VIDIOC_ENUMAUDIO _IOWR ('V', 65, struct v4l2_audio)
00887 #define VIDIOC_ENUMAUDOUT     _IOWR ('V', 66, struct v4l2_audioout)
00888 #define VIDIOC_G_PRIORITY       _IOR  ('V', 67, enum v4l2_priority)
00889 #define VIDIOC_S_PRIORITY       _IOW  ('V', 68, enum v4l2_priority)
00890 
00891 /* for compatibility, will go away some day */
00892 #define VIDIOC_OVERLAY_OLD         _IOWR ('V', 14, int)
00893 #define VIDIOC_S_PARM_OLD          _IOW  ('V', 22, struct v4l2_streamparm)
00894 #define VIDIOC_S_CTRL_OLD          _IOW  ('V', 28, struct v4l2_control)
00895 #define VIDIOC_G_AUDIO_OLD         _IOWR ('V', 33, struct v4l2_audio)
00896 #define VIDIOC_G_AUDOUT_OLD        _IOWR ('V', 49, struct v4l2_audioout)
00897 #define VIDIOC_CROPCAP_OLD         _IOR  ('V', 58, struct v4l2_cropcap)

00899 #define BASE_VIDIOC_PRIVATE   192       /* 192-255 are private */

00902 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00903 /*
00904  *
00905  *   V 4 L 2   D R I V E R   H E L P E R   A P I
00906  *
00907  *   Some commonly needed functions for drivers (v4l2-common.o module)
00908  */
00909 #include <linux/fs.h>
00910 
00911 /*  Video standard functions  */
00912 extern unsigned int v4l2_video_std_fps(struct v4l2_standard *vs);
00913 extern int v4l2_video_std_construct(struct v4l2_standard *vs,
00914                         int id, char *name);
00915 
00916 /* prority handling */
00917 struct v4l2_prio_state {
00918      atomic_t prios[4];
00919 };
00920 int v4l2_prio_init(struct v4l2_prio_state *global);
00921 int v4l2_prio_change(struct v4l2_prio_state *global, enum v4l2_priority *local,
00922                enum v4l2_priority new);
00923 int v4l2_prio_open(struct v4l2_prio_state *global, enum v4l2_priority *local);
00924 int v4l2_prio_close(struct v4l2_prio_state *global, enum v4l2_priority *local);
00925 enum v4l2_priority v4l2_prio_max(struct v4l2_prio_state *global);
00926 int v4l2_prio_check(struct v4l2_prio_state *global, enum v4l2_priority *local);
00927 
00928 /* names for fancy debug output */
00929 extern char *v4l2_field_names[];
00930 extern char *v4l2_type_names[];
00931 extern char *v4l2_ioctl_names[];
00932 
00933 /*  Compatibility layer interface  --  v4l1-compat module */
00934 typedef int (*v4l2_kioctl)(struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
00935                   unsigned int cmd, void *arg);
00936 int v4l_compat_translate_ioctl(struct inode *inode, struct file *file,
00937                       int cmd, void *arg, v4l2_kioctl driver_ioctl);
